oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sergeant Alvin C. York delivering his home-grown corn meal

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Men; Soldiers; Heroes; Farmers; Trucks; Farm produce; Millers; Flour & meal industry
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Fentress County (Tenn.); Jamestown (Tenn.); Corn meal; Grain -- Milling
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sergeant Alvin C. York, as a miller, driving his truck into Jamestown, Tennessee, with a load of "York Special" home-ground corn meal. Four men are riding in the back of the truck with the bags of corn meal.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee. Dept. of Conservation
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sergeant Alvin C. York's ancestors came to the upper Wolf River region around 1800. The York Mill was built about 1880. The millhouse was constructed on stacked rock and employed a millrace to turn the turbine, which was almost entirely submerged when functioning.
